trial_identification.studytitle: Effects of mobilization of the neuraxis in patients with temporomandibular dysfunction.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of central nervous system mobilization versus cervical mobilization on degree of mouth opening in patients with temporomandibular dysfunction

interventions.comparator:
One control group.
The Active group treatment is only passive motion cervical as it is possible that participants may benefit from this treatment
Treatment administered by a physiotherapist.
1 x 15 minute session per week;
-12 weeks

primaryOutcome.outcome:
Improvement of mouth opening
Is evaluated with digital calipers.

secondaryOutcome.outcome:
Improved pain
Is evaluated with "pressure algometer"

Improved cervical mobility
Is evaluated with goniometry

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Sign an "informed consent" to participate in the study. This document briefly explains the objectives of the study, guaranteeing confidentiality of the data according to the law 15/1999 of Protection of Personal Data. - Submit a decrease in joint range of the temporomandibular joint in the vertical opening less than 40 mm at the discretion of Maglione. - Have symptoms of cracking and / or noise in the temporomandibular joint. - Pain in the facial and masticatory muscles
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Having a chronic rheumatic disease (ankylosing spondylitis, rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis and so on. - Having had a fracture and / or trauma to the jaw, mandibular condyle, cervical spine, cranial vault or skull base. - Being pregnant. - Post-surgical state any surgery three months prior to study participation. - Submit neurodegenerative diseases. - Have taken muscle relaxants or anti-inflammatory medication in the last 24 hours.

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
The overall objective of this study is to improve mouth opening in temporomandibular joint mobilization of the neuraxis, and to analyze the additional effects in reducing pain at the level of the masseter, cervical muscles and trigeminal branches and improving the cervical mobility in all three planes of space.
The aim is to check with trigeminal nerve enhancement and nerve trunk there is an increased mobility of the temporomandibular joint and a consequent decrease in pain sensitivity. Using the collapse or slump position for treatment.
